New Records: Ecuador earned their first points of the tournament
Key Match Events: Ecuador's Moises Caicedo attempted to block a clearance by Jamaica's goalkeeper Jahmali Waite
Jamaica's Ethan Pinnock's effort was blocked by the Ecuador defense
Jamaica thought they had earned a penalty in the 73rd minute but the referee decided not to award a spot kick
Alan Minda scored in the 91st minute with a goal from a classic counter-attack
Pre-Game Insights: Ecuador were beaten by Venezuela in their Group B opener
Jamaica lost their opener to Mexico and must now win their final group game against Venezuela to have any hope of advancing
Post-Match Reflections: Ecuador's victory gave them their first points of the tournament, moving them level on three each with Mexico and Venezuela
Jamaica's loss left them on the brink of elimination
Miscellaneous Highlights: The top two teams from the group will progress to the quarter-finals
Jamaica play Venezuela in Austin, Texas and Mexico face Ecuador in Glendale, Arizona in the final round of Group B matches on Sunday
